etymology.description: 笨(stupid; clumsy) + 蛋(egg; pejorative ‘person’) = idiot.
etymology.interpretation: Literally “stupid egg,” with 蛋 used colloquially as a suffix meaning ‘person,’ forming a mild insult. Often playful among friends but can be rude depending on tone and context.

parts.english: egg; ovum; suffix for person (pejorative); egg-shaped

examples.chinese: 他有时开玩笑叫我笨蛋(他有時開玩笑叫我笨蛋)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yǒu shí kāi wánxiào jiào wǒ bèn dàn.
examples.english: He sometimes jokingly calls me an idiot.

examples.chinese: 别骂人笨蛋(別罵人笨蛋)，试着耐心解释(試著耐心解釋)。
examples.pinyin: Bié mà rén bèn dàn, shìzhe nàixīn jiěshì.
examples.english: Don’t call people idiots; try to explain patiently.
